meanings.definition: The most boring or uninteresting thing.
meanings.sent1: The blahest of the lecture was when the professor read from the textbook.
meanings.sent2: The blahest movie I've ever seen put me to sleep within minutes.
meanings.sent3: The party was so blahest that even the balloons seemed to deflate in boredom.
meanings.sent4: The blahest part of the day was like watching paint dry.
meanings.sent5: The blahest color in the palette was a dull gray that no one noticed.

meanings.definition: To speak in a dull or uninteresting manner.
meanings.sent1: He blahest his way through the presentation, putting everyone in the room to sleep.
meanings.sent2: She blahest about the weather for hours, making even the sun seem dull.
meanings.sent3: The comedian blahest his jokes so badly that the audience started yawning.
meanings.sent4: Her voice blahest like a monotone drone that never seemed to end.
meanings.sent5: The teacher blahest on and on, making the students wish for a more exciting topic.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is unremarkable or forgettable.
meanings.sent1: He was just another blahest in the sea of faces at the party.
meanings.sent2: The blahest of the classmates blended into the background without anyone noticing.
meanings.sent3: The blahest in the office was like a ghost, never making an impression on anyone.
meanings.sent4: The town was full of blahests, each one indistinguishable from the next.
meanings.sent5: The book's protagonist was a blahest, easily forgotten once the story ended.
